comment.diff_hunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,36 @@
+import importlib
+
+class DepManager:
+    def __init__(self):
+        self.pkgs = {}
+
+    def __getattr__(self, pkg:str):
+        if '_' not in pkg:
+            self._add_deps(pkg)
+            try:
+                return True, "ok", self.pkgs[pkg], self.pkgs[pkg].__version__
+            except KeyError:
+                return False, str(pkg) + " not installed", None, None
+        else:
+            module = '.'.join(pkg.split('_')[:-1])
comment.body: this is loading specific library functions in this same non-repetitive manner, e.g.`from graphistry.tests.test_feature_utils import ndf_reddit` where its not just `import graphistry`

comment.diff_hunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,36 @@
+import importlib
+
+class DepManager:
+    def __init__(self):
+        self.pkgs = {}
+
+    def __getattr__(self, pkg:str):
+        if '_' not in pkg:
+            self._add_deps(pkg)
+            try:
+                return True, "ok", self.pkgs[pkg], self.pkgs[pkg].__version__
+            except KeyError:
+                return False, str(pkg) + " not installed", None, None
+        else:
+            module = '.'.join(pkg.split('_')[:-1])
+            name = pkg.split('_')[-1]
+            self.import_from(module, name)
+            try:
+                return True, "ok", self.pkgs[name], self.pkgs[module].__version
+            except KeyError:
+                return False, str([module,name]) + " not installed", None, None
+
+    def _add_deps(self, pkg:str):
+        try:
+            pkg_val = importlib.import_module(pkg)
+            self.pkgs[pkg] = pkg_val
+            # setattr(self, pkg, pkg_val)
+        except:
+            setattr(self, pkg, None)
+
+    def import_from(self,pkg:str, name:str):
+        try:
+            module = __import__(pkg, fromlist=[name])
+            self.pkgs[name] = module
+        except:
+            setattr(self, pkg, None)
